      • removeEndPoints

        public void removeEndPoints(String key,
                            List<com.att.scld.grm.types.v1.ServiceEndPoint> epsToRemove)
        This method provides safe entry for removing multiple endpoints from the ENDPOINT CACHE only. It obtains a lock, removes each endpoint if it exists. Because it has a lock, it should be thread safe for multiple grm edge instances watching the API Server.

        In the event that no Endpoint exists, a log is printed and endpoint removal is skipped.
        In the event that the cache no longer has entries after the removal, the key is removed.

        Parameters:
        key - of the cache
        value - List object to remove from the cache.

      • removeEndPoint

        public void removeEndPoint(Object key,
                           Object value)
        This method provides safe entry for removing a single endpoint from the ENDPOINT CACHE only. It obtains a lock, removes an endpoint if it exist. Because it has a lock, it should be thread safe for multiple grm edge instances watching the API Server.

        In the event that no Endpoint exists, a log is printed and endpoint removal is skipped.
        In the event that the cache no longer has entries after the removal, the key is removed.

        Parameters:
        key - of the cache
        value - ServiceEndPoint object to remove from the cache.

      • addEndPoints

        public void addEndPoints(Object key,
                         Object value)
        This method provides safe entry for adding multiple endpoints with the same key to the ENDPOINT CACHE only. It obtains a lock, adds each endpoint if it does not exist. Because it has a lock, it should be thread safe for multiple grm edge instances watching the API Server.

        It should handle the case where the cache for this key doesn't exist by creating a new list to add to.

        Parameters:
        key - of the cache
        value - List of new SEP objects to add to a cache.

      • addEndPoint

        public void addEndPoint(Object key,
                        Object value)
        This method provides safe entry for adding endpoints to the ENDPOINT CACHE only. It obtains a lock, adds an endpoint if it does not exist. Because it has a lock, it should be thread safe for multiple grm edge instances watching the API Server.

        It should handle the case where the cache for this key doesn't exist by creating a new list to add to.

        Parameters:
        key - of the cache
        value - ServiceEndPoint object to add to a cache.
